note.p: American philologist, author, and editor. Studied at Princeton and in Germany. Professor of Greek, University of Virginia, 1856; also professor of Latin, 1861–6. Served in the Confederate army during university vacations from 1861; severely wounded in 1864. Professor of Greek, Johns Hopkins University, 1876–1915. Founder and editor of the American Journal of Philology, 1880–1920.
